title: December 2
description:
This week's milestone: Milo went on his first sleepover! He and Felix spent the night at Kora and Torin's house. It went very well. Milo was so proud and excited to be allowed go along with Felix. Felix, for his part, enjoyed playing big brother, from helping Milo pack his overnight bag to solemnly promising mom he would take good care of him. Apparently, Torin and Kora took turn playing with Milo. It also helps that Milo has always had a soft spot for Cindee. We hear Milo snuggled with her in bed for an hour in the morning.

As for us, we spent the childless evening at home, watching episode after episode of the TV series Heroes (we got the first season on DVD for the occasion). It felt decadent.

children.title: Felix & Torin
children.description: Fairy Torin and Felix Skywalker at Owen and Kahlil's costumed birthday party in the park.

children.title: Ruby
children.description: Ruby (Emmett's little sister) layered a Spiderman costume on top of her regular spider costume.

children.title: Douglas & Phin
children.description: Douglas looked fabulous. Solange brought  a large pile of dress-ups for both children and adults.

children.title: Lucie
children.description: Lucie enjoyed the extra warmth from the sparkly dress and the wig. It was a cold cold day.

children.title: Milo Treed
children.description: Yoda Milo in a tree, eating chips. The kids pretended they were on the forest moon of Endor, land of the Ewoks.

children.title: Cake
children.description: Once again, Solange created an amazing masterpiece of a cake. Yum!

children.title: Finn
children.description: Finn admires the cake... can I have a slice now?

children.title: Birthday Boys
children.description: Owen and Kahlil were born on October 22 one year apart. Owen turned 6, Kahlil turned 5.

children.title: Austin's Party
children.description:
This photo is here to prove that we went out to an actual grownup party on Saturday night. Can you believe it? The party was thrown by Austin and his many roommates. There was a DJ, a crowded dance floor, and a well-stocked bar. The vast majority of guests didn't have children. Weird. There is a whole other world out there!

Pictured: Christina (in an amazing dress she made herself), Austin and Celeste.

children.title: Pollock Painting
children.description: Felix is studying Jackson Pollock at school. What a revelation: "Scribble scrabble can be beautiful!". Last year, some kids used to make fun of Felix's immature drawing skills, and now he finds out that some famous artists did nothing but splatters of paints. How wonderful! This inspired Felix to roll up his sleeves and start painting, Jackson Pollock style.

children.title: More Painting
children.description: Milo go excited about it too. Felix explained the techniques to him: you can wave your paintbrush in the air, or paint a rock and roll it around the paper, or pour some paint directly on the paper. Anything goes! Both kids particularly liked the anecdote that Jackson Pollock's shoes were all splashed with paint.
